Author: jl777c#5810
Content:
```while true
do
./komodo-cli -ac_name=XUZ DEX_broadcast ffff
done
```

Author: jl777c#5810
Content:
above is a blaster loop. it seems you can launch more than one on a single node, but with current txpow it will saturate pretty fast. for max throughput change:
#define KOMODO_DEX_TXPOWBITS 12   -->
#define KOMODO_DEX_TXPOWBITS 1
at that setting, a single node can push out about 500 to 1000 per second

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: a p2p network should have each node having random 3+ other nodes as local peers

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: not sure if you are able to set up such a network automatically

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: you dont want it fully connected

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: if write such test suit on python we'll have rpc proxies for all nodes - the just `getpeersinfo` for each and some combinatorics peers ban before the test start

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: ok, it is lower priority than functionality testing as we already did a bunch of load testing

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: or even start 4th node with hardcoded `addnode` ips of previous three and so on

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: that wont work

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: you need to generate all the nodes and make a list of ip addresses

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: then on each one, pick 4 random nodes and addnode those

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the important thing is that it is randomly selected peers, any pattern in the peer selection will lead to suboptimal connectivity

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but before any stress test, i need to fix the mutex (lack of) problem and speed up the tag creation/lookup, once that is done, there shouldnt be any more significant changes to the internals
